default: (a)一件{@item 锁子甲|phb} 或 (b)一件{@item 皮甲|phb}、一把{@item 长弓|phb}和{@item 箭(20)|phb|20支箭}
(a)一把{@filter 军用武器|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}和一面{@item 盾牌|phb} 或 (b)两把{@filter 军用武器|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a)一把{@item 轻弩|phb}和{@item 弩矢(20)|phb|20支弩矢} 或 (b)二把{@item 手斧|phb}
(a)一套{@item 地城探险家套装|phb} 或 (b)一套{@item 探索者套装|phb}

classFeatures.name: 战斗风格
entries: 你采用一种特殊的战斗风格以做为你的专业。从下列选项中选择一种。你不能获得相同的战斗风格选项超过一次，即使你有机会再选择它也一样。

entries.name: 弓道
entries: 你在使用远程武器进行的攻击检定中获得+2加值。

entries.name: 近身射手
entries: 当你在距离一个敌意生物5呎以内时进行一次远程攻击，你在该攻击检定中并不会具有劣势。你的远程攻击忽略距离你30呎内目标的半掩护和四分之三掩护。你在远程攻击的攻击检定中获得+1加值。

entries.name: 防御
entries: 当你穿戴护甲时，你的AC获得+1加值。

entries.name: 决斗
entries: 当你单手持用一把近战武器，且没有持用其他武器时，你在使用该武器所进行的伤害骰中获得+2加值。

entries.name: 巨武战斗
entries: 当你在使用一把以双手持用的近战武器所进行攻击的伤害骰中骰出了1或2的结果，你可以重骰该骰，且必须使用新的掷骰结果，即使其结果仍然是1或2。该武器必须具有双手或可双手属性才能让你获得这个好处。

entries.name: 水手
entries: 只要你未穿戴重甲或使用盾牌，你就拥有等同于你正常移动速度的游泳速度和攀爬速度，且你的AC获得+1加值。

entries.name: 守护
entries: 当一个你所能看见的生物攻击一个距离你5呎内你以外的目标，你可以使用你的反应以让该攻击检定承受劣势。你必须持握一面盾牌。

entries.name: 坑道斗士
entries: 以一个附赠动作，你可以进入防御架式并持续直到你的下个回合开始。当你处于防御架式时，你可以进行借机攻击而无需使用你的反应，且你可以处于你触及范围内的生物移动超过5呎时使用你的反应对它进行一次近战攻击。

entries.name: 双武器战斗
entries: 当你进行双武器战斗时，你可以将你的属性调整值加入第二次攻击的伤害中。

classFeatures.name: 回气
entries: 你拥有有限的充沛精力让你得以利用于保护自己不受伤害。在你的回合，你可以使用一个附赠动作以回复等同于{@dice 1d10}+你的战士等级的生命值。
一旦你使用此能力，你必须完成一次短休或长休后才能再使用它。

classFeatures.name: 动作如潮
entries: 从2级开始，你可以短暂地驱策自己超越你的极限。在你的回合，你可以在你原本的动作和可能的附赠动作之后，另外再采取一次额外的动作。
一旦你使用此能力，你必须完成一次短休或长休后才能再使用它。从17级开始，你可以在一次休息前使用它二次，但同个回合只能使用一次。

classFeatures.name: 武术范型
entries: 在3级时，你从可选列表中选择一种你致力在你战斗风格和技巧中达成的范型。你所选择的范型将在3级、7级、10级、15级、和18级时赋予你新的能力。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至4级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 额外攻击
entries: 从5级开始，每当你在你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作，你可以攻击二次，而非一次。
当你在此职业升至11级时，攻击的次数增加到三，且当你在此职业升至20级时，攻击的次数增加到四。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至6级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 武术范型能力
entries: 在7级时，你获得一个由你武术范型所赋予的能力。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至8级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 不屈
entries: 从9级开始，你可以在你一次失败的豁免检定中重骰。若你这么做，你必须使用新的掷骰结果，且你直到完成一次长休之前都不能再使用此能力。
从13级开始，你可以在长休之间使用此能力二次，且从17级开始，你可以在长休之间使用此能力三次。

classFeatures.name: 武术范型能力
entries: 在10级时，你获得一个由你武术范型所赋予的能力。

classFeatures.name: 额外攻击(2)
entries: 从11级开始，每当你在你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作，你可以攻击三次。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至12级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 不屈(2次)
entries: 在13级时，你可以在长休之间使用不屈二次。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至14级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 武术范型能力
entries: 在15级时，你获得一个由你武术范型所赋予的能力。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至16级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 动作如潮(2次)
entries: 在17级时，你可以在一次休息前使用动作如潮二次，但同个回合只能使用一次。

classFeatures.name: 不屈(3次)
entries: 在17级时，你可以在长休之间使用不屈三次。

classFeatures.name: 武术范型能力
entries: 在18级时，你获得一个由你武术范型所赋予的能力。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至19级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 额外攻击(3)
entries: 从20级开始，每当你在你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作，你可以攻击四次。

subclassFeatures.name: 勇士
entries: 勇士范型专注于发展纯粹的身体能力，将其磨练到完美。那些仿效于此范型的人们结合严格的训练和卓越的身体素质以造成最致命的打击。

entries.name: 强化重击
entries: 从你在3级选择此范型开始，你的武器攻击将在骰出19或20时造成重击。

entries.name: 运动健将
entries: 从7级开始，你可以将你熟练加值的一半（向上取整）加入任何你尚未加入熟练加值的力量、敏捷、或体质检定中。
此外，当你进行助跑跳远时，你可以跨越的距离将增加等同于你力量调整值的呎数。

entries.name: 额外战斗风格
entries: 在10级时，你可以从战斗风格的职业能力中选择第二个选项。

entries.name: 卓越重击
entries: 从15级开始，你的武器攻击将在骰出18~20时造成重击。

entries.name: 生还者
entries: 在18级时，你领悟了战斗中的强韧的巅峰。在你的每个回合开始时，若你剩余的生命值不超过最大值的一半，则你回复等同于5+你的体质调整值的生命值。你并不会在生命值为零时获得这个好处。

subclassFeatures.name: 战斗大师
entries: 那些致力达成战斗大师范型的人们磨练着代代相传的武术技巧。对于战斗大师而言，战斗是一门学问，有时甚至囊括了战斗以外的专业，像是武器锻造和书法等等。并非所有战士都能吸收那些反映在战斗大师范型中的历史、理论、和艺术等学问，但那些能做到的都是拥有出色技巧和知识的全方位战士。

entries.name: 战争学徒
entries: 在3级时，你获得一种你所选的{@filter 工匠工具|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=artisan tool}的熟练。

entries.name: 战斗卓越
entries: 当你在3级时选择此范型时，你学会各种战技，并借由被称作卓越骰的特殊骰子驱动它们。

entries.name: 战技
entries: 你学会三个自选战技，参见下列「战技」条目。许多战技将以某些方式强化一次攻击。你只能为每次攻击使用一种战技。
你将在7级、10级、和15级时学会二个额外的战技。每次你学会新的战技时，你也可以将一个你已知的战技取代成另一个不同的战技。

entries.name: 卓越骰
entries: 你拥有四颗卓越骰，这四颗卓越骰为{@dice d8}。卓越骰将在你使用战技时被花费。你在完成一次短休或长休后恢复你花费掉的卓越骰。
你将在7级、和15级时再获得一颗卓越骰。

entries.name: 豁免检定
entries: 你的部分战技会要求你的目标进行一次豁免检定以对抗战技的效果。这个豁免检定DC的计算方式如下：

entries.name: 指挥官奇袭
entries: 当你在你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作时，你可以放弃你的其中一次攻击，并使用一个附赠动作以指挥你的其中一个同伴进行奇袭。当你这么做时，选择一个能够看见或听见你的友善生物，并消耗一颗卓越骰。该生物可以立刻使用它的反应以进行一次武器攻击，并将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中。

entries.name: 缴械击
entries: 当你以一次武器攻击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰并尝试使目标缴械，强迫它掉落一个它正持握且你所选择的物品。你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中，且目标必须进行一次力量豁免。若豁免失败，它将掉落你所选择的该物体。该物体将落在它的脚边。

entries.name: 扰乱击
entries: 当你以一次武器攻击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以干扰该生物，为你的盟友制造良机。你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中。在你的下个回合开始前，下一次你以外的攻击者对目标所进行的攻击检定将具有优势。

entries.name: 躲闪步伐
entries: 当你移动时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰，掷该卓越骰并将骰出的数字加入你的AC中直到你停止移动。

entries.name: 诡诈击
entries: 你可以消耗一颗卓越骰并在你的回合使用一个附赠动作以进行佯攻，选择一个距离你5呎内的生物做为你的目标。你在该回合对该生物的下一次攻击检定中具有优势。若该攻击命中，则将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中。
若你在获得这个优势的回合中没有使用它，则你将会失去这个优势。

entries.name: 挑衅击
entries: 当你以一次武器攻击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以尝试挑衅目标攻击你。你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中，且目标必须进行一次感知豁免。若豁免失败，则直到你的下个回合结束前，目标对你以外的对象所进行的所有攻击检定都将承受劣势。

entries.name: 突刺击
entries: 当你在你的回合进行一次近战武器攻击时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以使你该攻击的触及范围增加5呎。若你命中，则你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中。

entries.name: 灵动击
entries: 当你以一次武器攻击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以调动你其中一个伙伴到一处更有利的位置。你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中，且你选择一个能够看见或听见你的友善生物。该生物可以使用它的反应以移动最多等同于它移动速度一半的距离，且不会触发来自你攻击目标的借机攻击。

entries.name: 恐吓击
entries: 当你以一次武器攻击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以尝试吓唬目标。你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中，且目标必须进行一次感知豁免。若豁免失败，它将因你陷入{@condition 恐惧}直到你的下个回合结束。

entries.name: 格挡
entries: 当另一个生物以一次近战攻击伤害你时，你可以使用你的反应并消耗一颗卓越骰以减少伤害。该伤害将减少等同于你卓越骰所骰出的数字+你的敏捷调整值。

entries.name: 精准击
entries: 当你对一个生物进行一次武器攻击检定，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以将它加入该检定中。你可以在进行攻击检定之前或之后使用此战技，但必须在任何攻击的效果适用前使用。

entries.name: 推撞击
entries: 当你以一次武器攻击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以尝试驱使目标后退。你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中，且若目标的体型为大型或更小，则它必须进行一次力量豁免。若豁免失败，你将目标推离你最多15呎距离。

entries.name: 鼓舞
entries: 在你的回合，你可以使用一个附赠动作并消耗一颗卓越骰以鼓舞你其中一个同伴的士气。当你这么做时，选择一个能够看见或听见你的友善生物。该生物将获得等同于你卓越骰所骰出的数字+你的魅力调整值的临时生命值。

entries.name: 反击
entries: 当一个生物在一次对你进行的近战攻击中失手，你可以使用你的反应并消耗一颗卓越骰以对该生物进行一次近战武器攻击。若你命中，则你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中。

entries.name: 横扫击
entries: 当你以一次近战武器攻击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以尝试以相同的攻击伤害另一个生物。选择另一个距离原本目标5呎内，且处于你触及范围的生物。若原本的攻击检定能够命中第二个生物，则它将受到等同于你卓越骰所骰出的数字的伤害。这个伤害的伤害类型与原本攻击所造成的伤害类型相同。

entries.name: 绊摔击
entries: 当你以一次武器攻击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗一颗卓越骰以尝试将目标击倒。你将卓越骰加入该攻击的伤害骰中，且若目标的体型为大型或更小，则它必须进行一次力量豁免。若豁免失败，则你将目标击倒{@condition 伏地}。

entries.name: 额外战技
entries: 在7级时，你学会二个你所选择的额外战技。

entries.name: 额外卓越骰
entries: 你在7级时获得一颗额外的卓越骰。

entries.name: 知己知彼
entries: 若你花费至少1分钟的时间在战斗外观察另一个生物或与之互动，则你可以得知某些关于它能力的情报。DM将会告诉你在下列两个你所选择的项目中，该生物的能力是与你相同、强于你、或是弱于你：

items: 力量属性值
敏捷属性值
体质属性值
护甲等级
当前生命值
总职业等级（若有）
战士职业等级（若有）

entries.name: 额外战技
entries: 在10级时，你学会二个你所选择的额外战技。

entries.name: 精通战斗卓越(d10)
entries: 在10级时，你的卓越骰变更为{@dice d10}。

entries.name: 额外战技
entries: 在15级时，你学会二个你所选择的额外战技。

entries.name: 额外卓越骰
entries: 你在15级时获得一颗额外的卓越骰。

entries.name: 顽强
entries: 从15级开始，当你骰先攻时且已经没有剩下的卓越骰时，你获得一颗卓越骰。

entries.name: 精通战斗卓越(d12)
entries: 在18级时，你的卓越骰变更为{@dice d12}。

subclassFeatures.name: Cavalier
entries: The archetypal Cavalier excels at mounted combat. Usually born to nobility and raised in a royal court, a Cavalier is equally at home leading a cavalry charge or exchanging witty repartee at a state dinner.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. You can choose to gain one tool proficiency in place of one skill proficiency.

entries.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: At 3rd level, you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount, you always land on your feet if you are capable of taking actions. Mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

entries.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a set of abilities that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Using Superiority Dice
entries: You can expend superiority dice to gain a number of different benefits:

items: When you make a check to influence or control a creature you are riding, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the check. You apply this bonus after making the check but before learning if it was successful.

When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the attack roll. You can use this ability before or after making the attack roll, but before any of the effects of the attack are applied.

When you make an attack with a lance while mounted, you can expend one superiority die to add it to your damage roll. In addition, the target of the attack must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

If either you or your mount is hit by an attack while you are mounted, you can expend one superiority die as a reaction, adding the number rolled to your or your mount's AC. If the attack still hits, you or your mount take half damage from it.

entries.name: Ferocious Charger
entries: At 7th level, you gain additional benefits when you use superiority dice to increase your damage when you attack with a lance. You can expend up to two superiority dice on the attack, adding both to the damage roll. If you spend two dice, the target has disadvantage on its Strength saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.

entries.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 18th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeatures.name: Cavalier v2
entries: The archetypal Cavalier excels at mounted combat. Usually born among the nobility and raised at court, a Cavalier is equally at home leading a cavalry charge or exchanging repartee at a state dinner. Cavaliers also learn how to guard those in their charge from harm, often serving as the protectors of their superiors and of the weak. Drawn to right wrongs or earn prestige, many of these fighters leave their lives of comfort to embark on glorious adventure.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

entries.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your mastery as a rider becomes apparent. You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount and descend no more than 10 feet, you can land on your feet if you're not {@condition incapacitated}.
Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

entries.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a set of combat abilities, referred to as maneuvers, which are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: Maneuvers. You spend your superiority dice on your maneuvers. You can use more than one maneuver per turn, but no more than one maneuver per attack. You know the maneuvers detailed under "Maneuvers" below.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: The maneuvers are presented in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Control Mount
entries: When you make a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check to influence a creature that you or an ally is riding, you can expend one superiority die, roll it, and add the number rolled to the check. You can do this before or after rolling the {@dice d20}, but before applying the results of the check.

entries.name: Precision Attack
entries: When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can expend one superiority die, roll it, and add it to the attack roll. You can use this ability before or after rolling the {@dice d20}, but before any of the effects of the attack are applied.

entries.name: Trip Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. Roll the die, and add it to the attack's damage roll. If the target is Large or smaller, it must also succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Warding Maneuver
entries: If you or a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can expend one superiority die as a reaction if you're wielding a weapon or a shield. Roll the die, and add the number rolled to the target's AC against that attack. If the attack still hits, the target has resistance against the attack's damage.

entries.name: Ferocious Charger
entries: At 7th level, you gain additional benefits when you use your Trip Attack maneuver. You can expend up to two superiority dice on it, adding both dice to the damage roll. When you spend two dice in this way, the target has disadvantage on its Strength saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain one superiority die.

entries.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 18th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeatures.name: 魔能骑士
entries: 魔能骑士范型将对所有战士习以为常的武术精通与谨慎的魔法研究相互结合。它们使用类似于法师所施展的魔法技巧，但尤其专注于八大学派中的两个：防护和塑能学派。防护系法术为魔能骑士在战斗中提供额外的保护，而塑能系法术则可以同时攻击复数敌人，让战士在战场上更加全面。这些骑士掌握着相对较少的法术，并将它们记在脑海中，而非纪录于法术书。

entries.name: 施法
entries: 当你升至3级时，你以施放法术的能力增进了你的战斗实力。请参阅{@book 第十章|PHB|10}以了解关于施法的规则，以及第十一章以查阅{@filter 法师法术列表|spells|class=wizard}。

entries.name: 戏法
entries: 你学会二个从{@filter 法师法术列表|spells|class=wizard}自选的戏法。你将在10级时学会一个额外的法师戏法。

entries.name: 法术位
entries: 魔能骑士施法表中显示了你有多少个法术位可以用来施放你一环或更高环的{@filter 法师法术|spells|class=wizard}。要施放其中一个法术，你必须消耗一个与该法术环阶相同或更高的法术位。你在完成一次长休后恢复所有你花费掉的法术位。
举例来说，如果你知晓一个1环法术{@spell 护盾术}，且你拥有一个1环和一个2环的法术位，则你可以使用其中任意一个法术位来施放{@spell 护盾术}。

entries.name: 一环或更高环的已知法术
entries: 你知晓三个从法师法术列表中自选的1环法术，其中二个必须从法师法术列表中的防护系和塑能系法术中选择。
魔能骑士施法表中的已知法术栏位显示了你会在何时学习到新的1环或更高环的法师法术。每个这些法术都必须是一个防护系或塑能系法术，且环阶也必须符合你所拥有法术位的环阶。举例来说，当你在此职业升至7级时，你可以学习一个新的1环或2环法术。
你在8级、14级、和20级时所学会的法术可以来自任何魔法学派。
每当你提升这个职业的等级时，你可以从法师法术列表中挑选一个法术来取代一个你目前已知的法师法术。新法术的环阶必须符合你所拥有法术位的环阶，且它必须是一个防护系或塑能系法术，除非你取代的法术是你在3级、8级、14级、或20级时所获得的来自任意魔法学派的法术。

entries.name: 施法属性
entries: 因为你是透过研读与记忆来习得你的法师法术，智力是你施展法师法术的施法属性。每当法术提及你的施法属性时，你将使用你的智力。此外，当决定你法师法术的豁免DC、以及使用法师法术进行攻击检定时，你使用你的智力调整值。

entries.name: 武器联结
entries: 在3级时，你学会一个用以在你和一把武器间创造出魔法联结的仪式。施展这个仪式的过程需要1小时，且可以在短休期间被施展。这把武器必须在整个仪式的过程中处于你的触及范围内，且在仪式结束时，你触碰该武器并创造出联结。
一旦你与一把武器建立联结，则除非你处于{@condition 无力}状态，否则你的联结武器不会被缴械。若该武器与你处于相同的存在位面，你可以在你的回合以一个附赠动作召唤该武器，使它瞬间被传送到你手中。
你可以有最多二把联结武器，但在只能以附赠动作一次召唤一把。若你尝试与第三把武器建立联结，则你必须打破与另外两把其中之一的联结。

entries.name: 战争魔法
entries: 从7级开始，当你使用你的动作以施放一个戏法，你能够以一个附赠动作进行一次武器攻击。

entries.name: 魔能打击
entries: 在10级时，你学会如何让你的武器打击削弱一个生物对你法术的抗性。当你以一次武器攻击命中一个生物，直到你的下个回合结束之前，该生物在下一次对抗你所施放法术时所进行的豁免检定将具有劣势。

entries.name: 秘法冲锋
entries: 在15级时，你可以在使用你的动作如潮能力时，传送最多30呎距离到一处你所能看见的未被占据空间。你可以在进行额外动作之前或之后传送。

entries.name: 精通战争魔法
entries: 从18级开始，当你使用你的动作以施放一个法术，你能够以一个附赠动作进行一次武器攻击。

subclassFeatures.name: Monster Hunter
entries: As an archetypal Monster Hunter, you are an expert at defeating supernatural threats. Typically mentored by an older, experienced Monster Hunter, you learn to overcome a variety of unnatural defenses and attacks, including those of undead, lycanthropes, and other creatures of horror.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Perception}. You can choose to gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|phb} in place of one skill choice.

entries.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a set of abilities that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a long or short rest. You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Using Superiority Dice
entries: You can expend superiority dice to gain a number of different benefits:

items: When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the attack roll. You can use this ability before or after making the attack roll, but before any of the effects of the attack are applied.

When you damage a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the damage roll. You can use this ability after rolling damage. If the attack causes the target to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, it has disadvantage on that save.

When you make an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this feature only before you learn if the save succeeded or failed.

When you make a Wisdom (Perception) check to detect a hidden creature or object, or a Wisdom (Insight) check to determine if someone is lying to you, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this feature after seeing the total but before learning if you succeeded or failed.

entries.name: Hunter's Mysticism
entries: At 3rd level, your study of the supernatural gives you a limited ability to use magic. You can cast {@spell detect magic} as a ritual. You can cast {@spell protection from evil and good}, but you cannot cast it again with this feature until you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
In addition, you gain the ability to speak one of the following languages of your choice: Abyssal, Celestial, or Infernal.

entries.name: Monster Slayer
entries: At 7th level, whenever you expend superiority dice to add to a damage roll, you can expend up to two dice instead of just one, adding both to the roll. Both dice are expended as normal. If the target of your attack is an aberration, a fey, a fiend, or an undead, you deal maximum damage with both dice, instead of rolling them.

entries.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.

entries.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 18th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeatures.name: 紫龙骑士(旗将)
entries: ​紫龙骑士是一群来自科米尔王国的战士。承诺于守护君王，它们对抗着来自王国疆域外的邪恶。他们的任务是做为游骑兵巡游祖国的土地，靠着判断、勇敢、以及忠诚以指引他们击败为恶者。
一名紫龙骑士能透过在战斗中的英勇表现以激励他人心中的崇高。在小村庄内，仅仅是一名骑士的存在就足以让兽人和土匪们放弃而另寻其他猎物。单独的骑士仅仅是一名技艺娴熟的战士，而当一名骑士领导着一队盟友，则即使是装备最差的民兵也将被转变成一队凶猛的军队。
骑士倾向于透过行动，而非话语带领众人。当骑士带头冲锋进攻时，骑士那勇敢的行动将唤醒友军那深藏于心中，就连自己也未曾想过的强大勇气和信念。

entries.name: 限制：骑士爵位
entries: 紫龙骑士绑定于科米尔骑士爵位中的一个特别阶级。
若你想在其他战役设定或想塑造一个不同于紫龙骑士的军阀，「旗将」将做为这个范型的通用称呼。

entries.name: 鼓舞战吼
entries: 当你在3级时选择此范型，你将学会如何激励你的盟友们战胜他们过去的伤害。
当你使用你的回气能力，你可以选择最多三个距离你60呎内且与你同盟的生物。只要他们可以看见或听见你，他们将各自回复等同于你战士等级的生命值。

entries.name: 皇家特使
entries: 紫龙骑士做为科米尔王室的外交特使。地位显赫的骑士们被认为其举止应当优雅。
在7级时，你获得{@skill 说服}技能的熟练。若你已经熟练于它，则你可以选择获得下列其中一个技能的熟练：{@skill 动物驯养}、{@skill 察言观色}、{@skill 威吓}、或{@skill 表演}。
你的熟练加值在你进行任何使用{@skill 说服}技能的属性检定时变为两倍。无论你是否透过此能力获得该技能的熟练，你都能享有这个好处。

entries.name: 振奋之潮
entries: 从10级开始，当你使用你的动作如潮能力，你可以选择一个距离你60呎内且与你同盟的生物。只要它可以看见或听见你，该生物就能够以它的反应进行一次近战或远程武器攻击。
从18级开始．你可以选择二个距离你60呎内且与你同盟的生物，而非一个。

entries.name: 意志壁垒
entries: 从15级开始，你可以将你不屈能力的好处扩展到一个盟友身上。当你决定使用不屈能力以重骰一次智力、感知、或魅力豁免检定，且你不处于{@condition 无力}状态时，你可以选择一个距离你60呎内，且在对抗相同效果的豁免检定中失败的盟友。若该生物可以看见或听见你，则它也可以重骰它的豁免检定，且必须使用新的掷骰结果。

entries.name: 振奋之潮
entries: 从18级开始．你可以选择二个距离你60呎内且与你同盟的生物，而非一个。

subclassFeatures.name: Scout
entries: The archetypal Scout excels at finding safe passage through dangerous regions. Scouts usually favor light armor and ranged weapons, but they are comfortable using heavier gear when faced with intense fighting.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in three of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}. You can choose to gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|phb} in place of one skill choice.

entries.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a set of abilities that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a long or short rest. You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Using Superiority Dice
entries: You can expend superiority dice to gain a number of different benefits:

items: When you make a check that allows you to apply your proficiency in {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}, you can expend one superiority die to bolster the check. Add half the number rolled on the superiority die (rounding up) to your check. You apply this bonus after making the check but before learning if it was successful.

When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the attack roll. You can use this ability before or after making the attack roll, but before any of the effects of the attack are applied.

If you are hit by an attack while wearing light or medium armor, you can expend one superiority die as a reaction, adding the number rolled to your AC. If the attack still hits, you take half damage from it.

entries.name: Natural Explorer
entries: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions. Choose one type of favored terrain: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp, or the Underdark. When you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to your favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled if you are using a skill that you're proficient in.
While traveling for an hour or more in your favored terrain, you gain the following benefits:

items: Difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel.
Your group can't become lost except by magical means.
Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.
If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.
While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

entries: You choose additional favored terrain types at 7th and 15th level.

entries.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 7th level.

entries.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.

entries.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 15th level.

entries.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: At 18th level, your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeatures.name: Arcane Archer
entries: An Arcane Archer studies a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. Among elves, Arcane Archers are some of their most elite warriors. These archers stand watch over the fringes of elven domains, keeping a keen eye out for trespassers and using magic-infused arrows to defeat monsters and invaders before they can reach elven settlements. Over the centuries, the methods of these elf archers have been learned by members of other races who can also balance arcane aptitude with archery.

entries.name: Arcane Arrow
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn to channel magic into your attacks with a longbow or shortbow.

entries.name: Create Magic Arrow
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can create one magic arrow in your hand. The arrow lasts until the end of the turn or until it hits or misses a target. You can fire the arrow from a shortbow or longbow. The arrow is a magic weapon that deals an additional {@dice 2d6} force damage on a hit.
You have two uses of this feature, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Arcane Shot
entries: When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see the Arcane Shots section below). Whenever you create a magic arrow with this feature, you can apply the benefits of one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow.
You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

entries.name: Archer's Lore
entries: At 3rd level, you learn a few skills relating to the typical duties of an Arcane Archer. You learn to understand magical theory and develop survival skills for wandering the wilds.
You gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Arcane Shots
entries: The Arcane Arrow feature lets you choose Arcane Shot options at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. These are all magical effects.

entries.name: Beguiling Arrow
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this arrow to temporarily beguile its target. Choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. If the arrow hits the target, the target can't attack the chosen ally or include that ally in a harmful area of effect until the end of your next turn. The target ignores this effect if it is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition. This effect also ends if the chosen ally deals any damage to the target.

entries.name: Brute Bane Arrow
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your arrow. If a creature is hit by the arrow, any bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage dealt by the creature's attacks is halved until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Bursting Arrow
entries: You imbue your arrow with a blast of force energy drawn from the school of evocation. If you hit a creature with this arrow, each creature within 10 feet of it takes {@dice 2d6} force damage.

entries.name: Defending Arrow
entries: You use abjuration magic to weave a charm that disrupts your enemy's magic. A creature hit by this arrow suffers disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Grasping Arrow
entries: When this arrow strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, thorny brambles that wrap around the target. The target hit by the arrow takes a -10 penalty to speed, and it takes {@dice 2d6} slashing damage if it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can touch it can use its action to try to remove the brambles, which requires a successful DC 10 Strength check. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute.

entries.name: Piercing Arrow
entries: You use transmutation magic to transform your arrow into an ethereal dart that passes through its targets. When you attack with this arrow, it fires forward in a line that is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long. You make a separate attack using your Arcane Arrow against each creature in that line.

entries.name: Seeking Arrow
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your arrow the ability to seek out your target, allowing the arrow to curve and twist its path in search of its prey. As an action, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute, and make a ranged attack against it, using the Arcane Arrow. The arrow flies around corners if necessary, and this attack ignores three-quarters cover, half cover, and disadvantage caused by the target being out of sight or being at long range. The attack automatically misses if the target is out of the weapon's range or if there is no path large enough for the arrow to travel to the target. If the arrow hits its target, you know it, but you don't learn the target's location unless it's within your line of sight.

entries.name: Shadow Arrow
entries: You weave illusion magic into your arrow, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with grasping shadows. Until the end of your next turn, the target hit by the arrow can't see more than 30 feet away.

entries.name: Conjure Arrows
entries: At 7th level, you learn a minor but useful magical trick. As an action, you can conjure 20 nonmagical arrows. The arrows appear in your hand or in a container, such as a quiver, on your body. The arrows remain for 10 minutes or until you use this feature again; they then vanish.

entries.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 7th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

entries.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 10th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

entries.name: Ever-Ready Arrow
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can conjure forth a magic-infused arrow more often than before. One minute after expending your last remaining use of Arcane Arrow, you regain one use of it.

entries.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 15th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

entries.name: Deadly Arrow
entries: At 18th level, your Arcane Arrow's bonus damage increases to {@dice 4d6} force damage.

entries.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 18th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeatures.name: Arcane Archer v2
entries: An Arcane Archer studies a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. Among elves, Arcane Archers are some of their most elite warriors. These archers stand watch over the fringes of elven domains, keeping a keen eye out for trespassers and using magic-infused arrows to defeat monsters and invaders before they can reach elven settlements. Over the centuries, the methods of these elf archers have been learned by members of other races who can also balance arcane aptitude with archery.

entries.name: Magic Arrow
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to infuse arrows with magic. Whenever you fire a nonmagical arrow from a shortbow or longbow, you can make it a magic arrow, with a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls. The magic fades from the arrow immediately after it hits or misses its target.

entries.name: Arcane Arrow
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see the "Arcane Shot Options" section below).

Once per turn when you fire a magic arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the {@action Attack} action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow. You decide to use the option when the arrow hits, unless the option doesn't involve an attack roll. You have two uses of this ability, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class: 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level. Each option also improves when you become an 18th-level fighter.

entries.name: Archer's Lore
entries: At 3rd level, you learn magical theory or some of the secrets of nature—typical for practitioners of this elven martial tradition. You gain proficiency in either the {@skill Arcana} or {@skill Nature} skill.

entries.name: Arcane Shot
entries: The Arcane Shot feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
If an option requires a saving throw, your Arcane Shot save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Banishing Arrow
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target to a harmless location in the Feywild. If the arrow hits a creature, the target must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, its speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 18th level in this class, a target also takes {@dice 2d6} force damage when the arrow hits it.

entries.name: Brute Bane Arrow
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your arrow. If your arrow hits a creature, the target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} necrotic damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the damage of the target's attacks is halved until the next turn.
The necrotic damage increases to {@dice 4d6} when you reach 18th level with this class.

entries.name: Bursting Arrow
entries: You imbue your arrow with a blast of force energy drawn from the school of evocation. If the arrow hits a creature, the target and each creature within 10 feet of it takes {@dice 2d6} force damage.
The force damage increases to {@dice 4d6} when you reach 18th level with this class.

entries.name: Grasping Arrow
entries: When this arrow strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, thorny brambles that wrap around the target. If the arrow hits a creature, the target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@dice 2d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength (Athletics) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.
The poison and slashing damage both increase to {@dice 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

entries.name: Mind-Scrambling Arrow
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this arrow to temporarily beguile its target. Choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. If the arrow hits a creature, the target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} psychic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it can't attack the chosen ally or include that ally in a harmful area of effect until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally deals any damage to the target.
The psychic damage increases to {@dice 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

entries.name: Piercing Arrow
entries: You use transmutation magic to transform your arrow into an ethereal dart that passes through its targets. You use transmutation magic to give your arrow an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow fires forward in a line that is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@dice 1d6} piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
The piercing damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

entries.name: Seeking Arrow
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your arrow the ability to seek out your target, allowing the arrow to curve and twist its path in search of its prey. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The arrow flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the arrow to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@dice 1d6} force damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location.
The force damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

entries.name: Shadow Arrow
entries: You weave illusion magic into your arrow, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with grasping shadows. If the arrow hits a creature, the target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} psychic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of your next turn.
The psychic damage increases to {@dice 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

entries.name: Curving Shot
entries: At 7th level, you learn how to direct an errant arrow toward a new target. When you make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

entries.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 7th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

entries.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 10th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

entries.name: Ever-Ready Shot
entries: Starting at 15th level, your magical archery is ever available to you when you need it most. If you roll initiative and have no uses of Arcane Shot remaining, you regain one use of it.

entries.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 15th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

entries.name: Extra Arcane Shot
entries: At 18th level, you learn an additional Arcane Shot option.

subclassFeatures.name: Knight
entries: The Knight is a colossus on the battlefield who can shrug off attacks and protect allies from harm. Knights fight from the saddle when they can, and in combat they are expected to seek out and lock down the mightiest of the enemy's forces. On adventures, they are the armored bulwark that strives to keep the rest of the party safe.

entries.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: Starting at 3rd level, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off it, you can automatically land on your feet if you aren't {@condition incapacitated} and you fall less than 10 feet.

entries.name: Implacable Mark
entries: At 3rd level, you excel at foiling attacks and protecting your allies by menacing your foes. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target is marked by you until the end of your next turn. A creature ignores this effect if the creature can't be {@condition frightened}.
The marked target has disadvantage on any attack roll against a creature other than you or someone else who marked it.

If a target marked by you is within 5 feet of you on its turn and it moves at least 1 foot or makes an attack that suffers disadvantage from this feature, you can make one melee weapon attack against it using your reaction. This attack roll has advantage, and if it hits, the attack's weapon deals extra damage to the target equal to your fighter level.

You can make this special attack even if you have already expended your reaction this round, but not if you have already used your reaction this turn. You can make this attack three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Noble Cavalry
entries: At 7th level, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Persuasion}, or {@skill Religion}. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

entries.name: Hold the Line
entries: At 10th level, you master the ability to harass and slow your enemies. As a reaction when a creature moves at least 1 foot within 5 feet of you, you can make one melee weapon attack against that creature. If you hit, the attack's weapon deals extra damage to the target equal to half your fighter level, and the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of this turn.

entries.name: Rapid Strike
entries: Starting at 15th level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you have advantage on a weapon attack against a target on your turn, you can forgo that advantage to immediately make an additional weapon attack against the same target as a bonus action.

entries.name: Defender's Blade
entries: At 18th level, you respond to danger with extraordinary vigilance. You can use your reaction for an opportunity attack even if you have already expended your reaction this round, but not if you have already used your reaction this turn.
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to AC while wearing heavy armor.

subclassFeatures.name: Samurai
entries: The Samurai is a fighter who draws on an implacable fighting spirit to overcome enemies. A Samurai's willpower is nearly unbreakable, and the enemies in a Samurai's path have two choices: yield or die fighting.

entries.name: Fighting Spirit
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the might of your willpower can shield you and help you strike true. As a bonus action on your turn, you can give yourself two benefits: advantage on all attack rolls and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. These benefits last until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature three times. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Elegant Courtier
entries: Starting at 7th level, your discipline and attention to detail allow you to excel in social situations that require strict adherence to etiquette. You can add your Wisdom modifier to any Charisma check you make to persuade or please a noble or anyone else of high social station.
You also gain proficiency in the {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, or {@skill Persuasion} skill (choose one). Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

entries.name: Unbreakable Will
entries: At 10th level, your superior willpower allows you to shrug off mind-assaulting effects. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (choose one).

entries.name: Rapid Strike
entries: Starting at 15th level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you have advantage on a weapon attack against a target on your turn, you can forgo that advantage to immediately make an additional weapon attack against the same target as a bonus action.

entries.name: Strength Before Death
entries: Starting at 18th level, your fighting spirit can delay the grasp of death. If you take damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you can delay that damage and immediately take a bonus turn, interrupting the current turn. You don't take the damage until the bonus turn ends. It is possible to do things, such as gaining resistance, that change how much of that damage you take.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Sharpshooter
entries: The Sharpshooter is a master of ranged combat. An excellent sniper and eagle-eyed scout, this fighter is a perilous foe who can defeat an entire war band so long as they are kept at range.

entries.name: Steady Aim
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, your aim becomes deadly. As a bonus action on your turn, you can take careful aim at a creature you can see that is within range of a ranged weapon you're wielding. Until the end of this turn, your ranged attacks with that weapon gain two benefits against the target:

items: The attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover.
On each hit, the weapon deals additional damage to the target equal to 2 + half your fighter level.

entries: You can use this feature three times. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Careful Eyes
entries: Starting at 7th level, you excel at picking out hidden enemies and other threats. You can take the {@action Search} action as a bonus action.
You also gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception}, {@skill Investigation}, or {@skill Survival} skill (choose one).

entries.name: Close-Quarters Shooting
entries: At 10th level, you learn to handle yourself in close combat. Making a ranged attack roll while within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose disadvantage on your roll.
In addition, if you hit a creature within 5 feet of you with a ranged attack on your turn, that creature can't take reactions until the end of this turn.

entries.name: Rapid Strike
entries: Starting at 15th level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you have advantage on a weapon attack against a target on your turn, you can forgo that advantage to immediately make an additional weapon attack against the same target as a bonus action.

entries.name: Snap Shot
entries: Starting at 18th level, you are ever ready to spring into action. If you take the {@action Attack} action on your first turn of a combat, you can make one additional ranged weapon attack as part of that action.

subclassFeatures.name: 魔射手
entries: 魔射手钻研着那将魔法编入攻击以产生超自然效果的独特精灵箭技。魔射手是精灵中最精锐的战士。他们会驻足守望着精灵领域的疆界，锐眼紧盯着入侵者，并射出灌注魔法的箭矢以在怪物和入侵者闯入精灵的居住地之前击溃它们。在几个世纪以来，这种精灵箭技也已经被其他能够在秘法才能和弓道中找到平衡的种族所习得。

entries.name: 魔射手学识
entries: 在3级时，通常为了成为这个精灵军事传统的实践者，你习得魔法理论或一部分的自然奥秘—。你选择获得{@skill 奥秘}或{@skill 自然}技能的熟练，且你选择习得{@spell 魔法技俩}或{@spell 德鲁伊伎俩}戏法。

entries.name: 秘法射击
entries: 在3级时，你习得在你其中一些射击中释放出特别的魔法效果。当你获得此能力时，你习得二个由你选择的秘法射击选项（参见下列的「秘法射击选项」）。
每个回合一次，当你使用{@item 短弓|phb}或{@item 长弓|phb}并做为{@action 攻击}动作的一部份射出一发箭矢，你可以将你的其中一个秘法射击选项应用于该箭矢。除非该选项不涉及攻击检定，否则你可以在箭矢命中一个生物时才决定是否使用该选项。你可以使用这个能力二次，且你在完成一次短休或长休后恢复所有你花费掉的次数。
你将在升至7级、10级、15级、和18级时获得一个额外的秘法射击选项。每个选项也都会在你成为一名18级战士时获得强化。

entries.name: 秘法射击选项
entries: 秘法射击能力让你得以在特定等级时选择选项。这些选项将在以下按照字母顺序排列呈现。它们全都是魔法效果，且每个选项都各自对应着一个魔法学派。
若某个选项要求进行一次豁免检定，则你的秘法射击豁免检定DC的计算方式如下：

entries.name: 放逐箭
entries: 你使用防护系魔法以尝试暂时地将你的目标放逐到一个位于妖精荒野的无害区域。被此箭命中的生物必须成功通过一次魅力豁免，否则将被放逐。当因为这个方式被放逐，目标的移动速度将归零，且陷入{@condition 无力}状态。在它的下个回合结束时，目标将重新出现在它离开时所在的空间，或若该空间已被占据则出现在最近一处未被占据空间。
在你本职业升至18级之后，当被此箭命中时，目标同时也将受到{@dice 2d6}力场伤害。

entries.name: 迷惑箭
entries: 你的惑控系魔法让这支箭能暂时地迷惑它的目标。被此箭命中的生物将受到额外的{@dice 2d6}精神伤害，且你选择其中一个距离目标30呎内的你的盟友。目标必须成功通过一次感知豁免，否则被所选的目标{@condition 魅惑}直到你的下个回合开始。这个效果会在所选的盟友攻击被{@condition 魅惑}目标、对目标造成伤害、或强迫它进行豁免检定时提早结束。
这个精神伤害将在你本职业升至18级时增加至{@dice 4d6}。

entries.name: 爆裂箭
entries: 你将汲取自塑能学派的力场能量注入你的箭矢。这股能量将在你攻击之后爆发。紧接在此箭命中一个生物之后，目标和所有距离它10呎内的其他生物都将各自受到{@dice 2d6}力场伤害。
这个力场伤害将在你本职业升至18级时增加至{@dice 4d6}。

entries.name: 衰弱箭
entries: 你将死灵系魔法编入你的箭矢中。被此箭命中的生物将受到额外的{@dice 2d6}死灵伤害。目标也必须成功通过一次体质豁免，否则它武器攻击所造成的伤害将被减半，持续直到你的下个回合开始。
这个死灵伤害将在你本职业升至18级时增加至{@dice 4d6}。

entries.name: 纠缠箭
entries: 当此箭击中它的目标，咒法系魔法将创造出一团纠缠着的有毒刺藤，紧紧缠绕着目标。被此箭命中的生物将受到额外的{@dice 2d6}毒素伤害，它的移动速度降低10呎，且它在每回合不透过传送而第一次移动1呎或以上的距离时，将再受到{@dice 2d6}劈砍伤害。目标或其他能够触及它的生物可以使用它的动作，并借由成功通过一次对抗你秘法射击豁免DC的力量（{@skill 运动}）检定以移除这些刺藤。否则，这些刺藤将持续存在长达1分钟，或直到你再次使用这个选项。
这个毒素伤害和劈砍伤害将在你本职业升至18级时增加至{@dice 4d6}。

entries.name: 穿透箭
entries: 你利用变化系魔法以将乙太属性赋予你的箭矢。当你使用此选项时，你不需要为此攻击进行攻击检定。取而代之，这支箭矢将在消失前向前射出一道1呎宽、30呎长的直线。这支箭矢将无害地穿过物体、忽略掩护。每个在直线内的生物都必须进行一次敏捷豁免。若豁免失败，该生物将受到如同被箭矢命中一样伤害，再加上额外的{@dice 1d6}穿刺伤害。若豁免成功，则目标只受到一半的伤害。
这个穿刺伤害将在你本职业升至18级时增加至{@dice 2d6}。

entries.name: 追踪箭
entries: 利用预言系魔法，你赋予你的箭矢追踪目标的能力。当你使用此选项时，你不需要为此攻击进行攻击检定。取而代之，选择一个你在过去1分钟内曾见过的生物。这支箭矢将飞向该生物，若有需要的话则绕过转角，并忽略四分之三掩护和半掩护。若该目标在此武器的射程内，且其存在一条能让箭矢通往目标的途径，则目标必须进行一次敏捷豁免。否则这支箭矢将在飞至最远距离之后消失。若豁免失败，目标将受到如同被箭矢命中一样伤害，再加上额外的{@dice 1d6}力场伤害，且你将得知目标当下所在的位置。若豁免成功，则目标只受到一半的伤害，且你无法得知它所在的位置。
这个力场伤害将在你本职业升至18级时增加至{@dice 2d6}。

entries.name: 暗影箭
entries: 你将幻术系魔法编入你的箭矢中，使它以暗影遮蔽你敌人的视线。被此箭命中的生物将受到额外的{@dice 2d6}精神伤害，且它必须成功通过一次感知豁免，否则直到你的下个回合开始前都无法看见任何5呎以外的事物。
这个精神伤害将在你本职业升至18级时增加至{@dice 4d6}。

entries.name: 魔法箭矢
entries: 在7级时，你获得将魔法注入箭矢的能力。每当你使用{@item 短弓|phb}或{@item 长弓|phb}射出一发非魔法箭矢，你可以使其在克服对非魔法攻击和伤害的抗性和免疫时被视作魔法箭矢。这个魔法将在它命中目标或失手时立刻从箭矢上消退。

entries.name: 曲射
entries: 在7级时，你学会如何将偏离的箭矢导向一个新的目标。当你使用魔法箭矢进行一次攻击检定并失手时，你可以使用一个附赠动作以对一个距离原本目标60呎内的不同目标重骰该攻击检定。

entries.name: 额外秘法射击选项
entries: 当你升至7级时，你获得一个你所选择的秘法射击选项。

entries.name: 额外秘法射击选项
entries: 当你升至10级时，你获得一个你所选择的秘法射击选项。

entries.name: 常备射击
entries: 从15级开始，每当战斗开始时，你都可以使用你的魔法箭术。当你骰先攻时且秘法射击已经没有剩下的使用次数，则你恢复一次使用次数。

entries.name: 额外秘法射击选项
entries: 当你升至15级时，你获得一个你所选择的秘法射击选项。

entries.name: 额外秘法射击选项
entries: 当你升至18级时，你获得一个你所选择的秘法射击选项。每个秘法射击选项也都会在你成为一名18级战士时获得强化。

subclassFeatures.name: 骑兵
entries: 这种范型擅长于骑乘作战。通常出身贵族，并在宫廷成长，骑兵既能在家乡领导骑兵队冲锋陷阵，也能在国宴中侃侃而谈。骑兵们也学习如何保护那些他们负责的人们不受伤害，并经常做为他们长官或弱者的保护者。被迫于惩奸除恶或赢取荣耀，许多这些战士选择离开他们安逸的生活，展开他们的光荣冒险。

entries.name: 额外熟练
entries: 当你在3级时选择此范型时，你获得下列其中一个你所选择技能的熟练：{@skill 动物驯养}、{@skill 历史}、{@skill 察言观色}、{@skill 表演}、或{@skill 说服}。或者，你学会一个你所选择的语言。

entries.name: 生而为骑
entries: 从3级开始，你做为骑兵的专业变得显而易见。你在进行避免从你的坐骑摔落的豁免检定中具有优势。若你从你的坐骑摔落且落下不超过10呎距离，只要你不处于{@condition 无力}状态，你就可以双脚着地。
最后，乘上或骑下一个生物只花费你5呎的移动速度，而非你移动速度的一半。

entries.name: 坚定印记
entries: 从3级开始，你可以威胁你的敌人，挫败它们的攻击并为伤害他人而惩罚它们。当你以一次近战武器攻击命中一个生物，你可以标记该生物直到你的下个回合结束。这个效果会在你陷入{@condition 无力}状态、你死亡、或者其他人标记该生物时提早结束。
当一个被标记的生物距离你5呎内，它将在任何不以你为目标的攻击检定中具有劣势。
此外，若一个被你标记的生物对你以外的任何对象造成伤害，你可以在你的下个回合以一个附赠动作对该被标记的生物进行一次特殊的近战武器攻击。你在该攻击检定中具有优势，且若命中，该攻击的武器将对目标造成等同于你战士等级一半的额外伤害。
无论你标记了多少生物，你能够进行这个特殊攻击的次数等同于你的力量调整值（最少一次），且你在完成一次长休后恢复所有你花费掉的次数。

entries.name: 防护战术
entries: 在7级时，你学会抵御对你、你的坐骑、或其他附近生物直接进行的攻击。若你或一个距离你5呎内且你所能看见的生物被一次攻击命中，且若你正持用一把近战武器或盾牌，则你能够以一个反应骰一颗{@dice 1d8}。骰这颗骰子，并将骰出来的数字加入目标对该次攻击的AC中。若该攻击仍然命中，则目标对该次攻击的伤害将具有抗性。
你可以使用这个能力的次数等同于你的体质调整值（最少一次），且你在完成一次长休后恢复所有你花费掉的次数。

entries.name: 坚守战线
entries: 在10级时，你成为了封锁你敌人行动的专家。处于你触及范围内的生物将在移动5呎或以上距离时引发来自你的借机攻击，且若你以一次借机攻击命中一个生物，目标的移动速度将被归零直到该回合结束。

entries.name: 勇猛冲锋
entries: 从15级开始，无论你是否乘骑，你都可以撞倒你的敌人。若你在攻击一个生物之前直线移动至少10呎，且该攻击命中，则目标必须成功通过一次力量豁免（DC为8+你的熟练加值+你的力量调整值），否则被击倒{@condition 伏地}你在每个你的回合只能使用这个能力一次。

entries.name: 警戒防卫者
entries: 从18级开始，你能以超凡警戒回应危险。在战斗中，你得到一个你可以在每个生物的回合（除了你的回合以外）采取一次的特殊反应。你只能使用这个特殊反应以进行一次借机攻击，且你不能在你采取你正常反应的同个回合使用它。

subclassFeatures.name: 武士
entries: 武士是一种以坚决战斗意志击溃敌人的战士。武士的信念几乎坚不可摧，且挡在武士道路前的敌人只有两种选择：投降，或者死战方休。

entries.name: 额外熟练
entries: 当你在3级时选择此范型时，你获得下列其中一个你所选择技能的熟练：{@skill 历史}、{@skill 察言观色}、{@skill 表演}、或{@skill 说服}。或者，你学会一个你所选择的语言。

entries.name: 战斗之魂
entries: 从3级开始，你在战斗中的强烈气势可以保护你并助你一击必中。在你的回合以一个附赠动作，你可以让你自己在该回合结束前的武器攻击检定都具有优势。当你这么做时，你同时获得5点临时生命值。这个临时生命值的数量将会在你本职业升至特定等级时增加，10级时增加至10点，15级时增加至15。
你可以使用这个能力三次，且你在完成一次长休后恢复所有你花费掉的次数。

entries.name: 典雅侍臣
entries: 从7级开始，你的修养和对细节的专注让你得以在社交场合崭露头角。每当你进行一次魅力（{@skill 说服}）检定时，你将在该检定中获得等同于你感知调整值的加值。
你的自我控制能力同时也让你获得了感知豁免的熟练。若你已经拥有此熟练，则你可以改为获得智力豁免或魅力豁免的熟练（由你选择）。

entries.name: 不懈战魂
entries: 从10级开始，当你骰先攻时且战斗之魂已经没有剩下的使用次数，则你恢复一次使用次数。

entries.name: 迅捷打击
entries: 从15级开始，你学会以准确度换取快速打击的方式。若你在你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作，且在对其中一个目标所进行的一次攻击检定中具有优势，你可以放弃该检定的优势，并做为同个动作的一部份对该目标进行一次额外的武器攻击。你每回合可以这么做不超过一次。

entries.name: 回光返照
entries: 从18级开始，你的战斗意志可以延后死亡的支配。若你受到将你生命值归零但没有当场杀死你的伤害，你可以使用你的反应以延后陷入{@condition 昏迷}的时机，且你可以中断当前的回合并立刻进行一个额外的回合。当你在这个额外回合期间的拥有0点生命值，受到伤害仍然会如往常一样导致一次失败的死亡豁免，且三次死亡豁免失败仍然会杀死你。当这个额外回合结束时，若你的生命值依旧为0点，你将陷入{@condition 昏迷}。
一旦你使用此能力，直到你完成一次长休之前你都不能再使用它。

subclassFeatures.name: Brute
entries: Brutes are simple warriors who rely on mighty attacks and their own durability to overcome their enemies. Some brutes combine this physical might with tactical cunning. Others just hit things until those things stop hitting back.

entries.name: Brute Force
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you're able to strike with your weapons with especially brutal force. Whenever you hit with a weapon that you're proficient with and deal damage, the weapon's damage increases by an amount based on your level in this class, as shown on the Brute Bonus Damage table.

entries.name: Brutish Durability
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your toughness allows you to shrug off assaults that would devastate others.

Whenever you make a saving throw, roll {@dice 1d6} and add the die to your saving throw total. If applying this bonus to a death saving throw increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: At 10th level, you can choose a second option from the Fighting Style feature.

entries.name: Devastating Critical
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you gain a bonus to that weapon's damage roll equal to your level in this class.

entries.name: Survivor
entries: At 18th level, you attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle. At the start of each of your turns in combat, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points or if you have more than half of your hit points left.

subclassFeatures.name: Warlord (Livestream)
entries: {@i Transcribed on 2018-03-28. [Square bracketed text] denotes transcriber's annotations.}

entries.name: Tactical Focus
entries: At 3rd level, your tactical acumen allows you to study an area of a battlefield and provide direction to your allies that can tilt a battle in your favor.

As a bonus action or as part of the attack action, you can select an area on the ground that measures 10 feet on each side. This area is your tactical focus. It remains your tactical focus until you use this ability again or you are unable to take actions.

When you select an area as your tactical focus, you choose one of your tactics to apply to that area. You gain three tactics at 3rd level. You gain an additional tactic at 7th and 15 level. Each time you complete a long rest, you can swap on of your tactics for a different one.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The stratagems are presented in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Advance
entries: You and your allies can move 10 ft. in your tactical focus for every 5 feet of movement expended there. {@i [Changed during stream to "You and your allies can basically teleport into your focus. Movement on allies turn." Specifically, the movement is not made as a reaction—your allies can use their movement on their turn(s) to move towards the focus, and gain bonuses to speed or other effects (for example, ignoring difficult terrain, or movement does not provoke opportunity attacks) to aid and incentivize this. Additionally, this may replace "Cover That Flank" in future.]}

entries.name: Clear the area
entries: If an ally hits a creature in your tactical focus with an attack, the ally can move that creature 5 ft. in addition to the attack's other effects.

entries.name: Cover That Flank
entries: When a hostile creature that you can see enters your tactical focus, up to three target creatures of your choice that can see the creature can use a reaction to move up to their speed. The targets must end their movement in the tactical focus. A target creature that ends this movement adjacent to the triggering creature regains its reaction.

entries.name: Get Down
entries: If an allied creature in your tactical focus must make a Dexterity saving throw it can use its reaction to move up to its speed. If this movement takes it out of the range or area of the effect that caused the saving throw, it is no longer subjected to the effect. {@i [In future, this may be changed to instead give advantage on the saving throw, or require the creature to drop prone, or cancel the creature's next move.]}

entries.name: Form Shield Wall
entries: Allies in your tactical focus gain a +2 bonus to AC while they are adjacent to an ally using a shield. {@i [In future, this will likely be changed to benefit only creatures not already wielding a shield, and to affect each creature at most once.]}

entries.name: Reorder Ranks
entries: Allies in your tactical focus do not provoke opportunity attacks while they are within 5 feet of an ally. In addition, you and your allies can end movement in an ally's space. That ally immediately moves so that you do not occupy the same space, but it must end that move at least partially occupying your tactical focus. {@i [Noted as requiring cleanup.]}

entries.name: Tactician's Insight
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can grant your allies useful tactical insights while they are in the area of your tactical focus.
You gain a number of uses of insight based on your fighter level.

As a bonus action or as a part of an attack action you grant insight to yourself or allies in your tactical focus. You grant this benefit to yourself and as many allies as you wish in your focus, but you cannot expend more uses than you currently have {@i [or more than the maximum in the table below. A creature can receive more than one Tactician's Insight when you take this action.]}

A creature that gains your insight can use it in two ways. It can regain hit points immediately upon receiving it. Roll {@dice 2d10} and the creature regains that many hit points. If the creature would gain hit points that place it above its maximum, it gains the difference as temporary hit points.
Alternatively, a creature can save the insight to use when it hits with an attack. It increases the attack's damage by {@dice 2d10}.
You regain expended uses of Tactician's Insight when you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Additional Tactic
entries: At 7th level, you learn an additional tactic of your choice.

entries.name: Tactical Gambits
entries: Starting at 7th level, your tactical cunning allows you to seize the moment in battle.
At 7th level, you learn two gambits. You learn an additional gambit at 10th and 18th level.
You use a gambit as an action. You can use your gambits a number of times based on your fighter level.
Each time you complete a long rest, you regain all expended uses of your gambits and can swap one of your gambits for a different one.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: A gambit sometimes requires a saving throw. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

entries.name: Gambits
entries: The gambits are presented in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Aggressive Advance
entries: You and your allies howl in rage and glower at your foes, making a display that sends fear into their hearts.

Hostile creatures within 60 feet of you that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is frightened of your tactical focus. A creature frightened by this effect can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. As part of this gambit, you may take the attack action. {@i [In future, may be changed to require you or an ally to be present within the focus.]}

entries.name: Cut Them Down!
entries: You direct your allies to strike with perfect timing. Landing blows just as your enemies are of balance to send them tumbling to the ground.

Until the end of your next turn, hostile creatures in your tactical focus that you can see must make Strength saves each time they are hit by an attack. On a failed save, they are knocked prone. As part of this gambit, you may take the attack action.

entries.name: Luring Gambit
entries: You entangle your weapon with a chose foe, luring it to duel you as your allies close in for the kill.

As part of this gambit, you may take the attack action. If you hit a creature with a weapon attack during your turn, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, your allies are invisible to it until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Pile On
entries: You direct your allies' attacks against a target, each blow building on the next to build a devastating result. Select a creature in your tactical focus that you can see. At the start of your next turn, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw if you or an ally has hit it with an attack since you used this ability. It suffers disadvantage on the saving throw if it has been hit by three or more attacks {@i [in future, this may be changed to "hit by three or more creatures"]}. On a failed saving throw, the creature is stunned until the end of your next turn.
As part of this gambit, you may take the attack action.

entries.name: Pincer Movement
entries: With precise timing, you order your allies to charge into the enemy, dealing body checks that leave your foes entangles and helpless.

Up to two allies that can see or hear you can use their reactions to move up to their speed. Any creature adjacent to both of your allies or to you and one of the chosen allies at the end of their movement must make a Strength saving throw or become restrained until the end of your next turn. As part of this gambit, you may take the attack action.

entries.name: Vexing Maneuvers
entries: With precise movements, you and your allies dash around the foes to leave them confused and unable to pick out their most dangerous targets.

Each enemy in your tactical focus that you can see must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, it cannot leave your tactical focus using its move until the end of your next turn. As part of this gambit you may take the attack action.

entries.name: Additional Gambit
entries: At 10th level, you learn an additional gambit of your choice.

entries.name: Lead from the Front
entries: At 10th level you strike with a cunning insight that allows your allies to make effective follow up attacks.
If you hit a creature with a weapon attack, it has disadvantage on all saving throws against your gambits until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Additional Tactic
entries: At 15th level, you learn an additional tactic of your choice.

entries.name: Tactical Maneuvers
entries: At 15th level, you can provide leadership that allows your allies to move in perfect harmony.

In place of moving, you can instead allow up to three allies who can see or hear you to move up to half their speed. The chosen allies must be capable of taking actions in order to move in this manner.

entries.name: Additional Gambit
entries: At 18th level, you learn an additional gambit of your choice.

entries.name: Perfect Coordination
entries: Starting at 18th level, you gain the ability to unleash a devastating combination of your allies' abilities. As a bonus action, select up to five allies who can see or hear you. They can use their reactions to immediately take actions.
Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Psychic Warrior (Livestream)
entries: {@i Transcribed on 2018-10-13. [Square bracketed text] denotes transcriber's annotations.}
A Psychic Warrior combines the study of psionics with martial training, yielding a warrior who can transcend their physical limits while delivering skilled, deadly attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the psionic spell list. You learn an additional wizard or psionic cantrip at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Psychic Warrior Spellcasting table shows how many spells slots you have to case your spells of 1st level or higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level spells of your choice chosen from the psionic spell list.

The Spells Known column {@i [currently unavailable]} of the Psychic Warrior Spellcasting table shows when you learn more spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be chosen from the psionic spell list, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots.
Whenever you gain a fighter level, you can replace one of the psionic spells you know with another spells of your choice from the psionic spell list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your spells. You use your Intelligence modifier whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Psychic Destroyer
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can expend your spell energy to imbue your attacks with psychic power. Once during your turn when you hit with a weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal psychic damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8.

entries.name: Psychic Guardian
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can expend your spell energy to protect your allies from harm. When an ally you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to grant that ally a bonus to AC equal to 3 + the spell slot's level, including against the triggering attack, until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Psychic Storm
entries: At 7th level, your aggression translates into an aura of disruptive psychic energy. If you cast a psionic cantrip or use the attack action on your turn, all hostile creatures within 10 feet of you take psychic damage equal to double your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).

entries.name: Psionic Recovery
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you use your Second Wind class feature you also regain an expended 1st-level spell slot.

entries.name: Psionic Surge
entries: At 15th level, you gain the ability to channel additional psionic power when you use your Action Surge class feature. Until the end of your turn, if your attack or spell causes a creature to take psychic damage, that creature takes an additional 1d10 psychic damage. A creature can take this additional damage only once during your turn.

entries.name: Mind Cleaver
entries: At 18th level, your attacks leave behind traces of disruptive, psychic energy. If you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause it to become vulnerable to psychic energy until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Weapon Master (Livestream)
entries: {@i Transcribed on 2018-10-13. [Square bracketed text] denotes transcriber's annotations.}

A weapon master follows the fighting techniques of the Sublime way. This martial discipline combines a variety of sources, from arcane and divine magic to the hardened resolve of a master warrior, to produce astounding battlefield effects.

entries.name: Martial Exploits
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to use your tactical acumen, physical prowess, and sometimes a dash of mystic energy to achieve astounding feats of martial skill.
You gain the ability to use martial exploits. You gain uses based on your fighter level, as shown on the Martial Exploits table. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long
You also gain access to one path of the Sublime Way at 3rd level. The Martial Exploits table also shows when you get access to additional paths as you gain fighter levels.
Whenever you gain a fighter level, you can choose to lose access to one path and replace it with access to a different one.

entries.name: Masterful Strike
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you gain the ability to use a martial exploit to land a telling blow. When you make a weapon attack, you can expend a martial exploit. Roll the dice for your exploit along with your attack. If your attack misses, you can use one or more of the exploit's dice results as a bonus to your attack. If the attack hits, apply any unused dice as a bonus to your weapon damage roll.

subclassFeatures.name: Paths of the Sublime Way
entries: Each path of the sublime way features a unique take on combat mastery. Many, but not all, require you to wield certain weapons to use their exploits.
When you use a martial exploit, you can choose to use one of the special exploits listed under one of the paths you know. You choose the special exploit when you decide to use a martial exploit.

Some of these abilities require you to roll fewer dice when using a martial exploit. You cannot use an ability that reduces the total dice you roll for the exploit to less than 1. Such an ability is beyond your skill.
Some of these abilities require a creature to make a saving throw. The DC for such a save is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Path of the Shadow Harlequin
entries: The Shadow Harlequin path is a school of artful sword play and mesmerizing flourishes. Its practitioners attack a foe's mind and body, maneuvering their foes into tactical blunders with cunning feints and sudden, surprising moves.
Shadow Harlequins typically fight with light, agile weapons, such as rapiers and short swords, but their talents are useful to almost any warrior.

entries.name: Come Forth to Dance
entries: Your weapon moves in a lazy, hypnotic pattern, luring your foe to blunder ahead and walk into your trap.

As an action, expend a martial exploit and select a creature that can see you within 15 feet of you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it moves up to 15 feet closer to you. You then make a single melee attack against it using your martial exploit with one die fewer.

entries.name: Cutting Dialogue
entries: If this exchange of blows is a dramatic play, let your rejoinder be its final act.

As a reaction when a creature makes a melee attack against you, you can expend a martial exploit and make a melee weapon attack against that creature. You can select one of the dice rolled and add it to your AC against the target's attack.

entries.name: Dramatic Exit
entries: Your overly dramatic strike distracts your opponent, allowing you to slip away from their grasp.
When you expend a martial exploit when making a melee weapon attack, you can move up to 5 feet, without provoking opportunity attacks, per exploit die rolled after your attack.

entries.name: Path of the Stone Dragon
entries: The Stone Dragon path focuses on brutal power and overwhelming toughness. Most of these exploits require you to attack with a two-handed melee weapon or a versatile melee weapon you wield in two hands.

Warriors of the Stone Dragon are often cruel destroyers. They fight with the subtlety and irresistible force of an avalanche. Their punishing attacks render their enemies immobile, allowing them to then take careful aim for one, final executioner's blow.

entries.name: Adamantine Bones
entries: You focus your mind and grit your teeth, pushing aside pain and drawing on wellsprings of energy that blot out the pain of your wounds.

When you expend a martial exploit when attacking with a two-handed melee weapon or a versatile one wielded in two hands, after rolling the dice you can select one or more of them. You gain temporary hit points equal to the total of the dice + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).
You can also activate this ability as a bonus action. In that case, you roll your martial exploit dice and gain temporary hit points equal to their total + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Colossus Strike
entries: You swing your weapon in an upward arc, catching your foe in the chest and sending them flying across the battlefield.

When you expend a martial exploit when attacking with a two-handed melee weapon or a versatile one wielded in two hands, after rolling the dice you can select one or more of them and disregard their result. For each die selected, you push the target 5 feet in a straight line along the ground if your attack hits.

entries.name: Jaws of the Stone Dragon
entries: Like a mighty dragon pouncing upon a helpless victim, you take stock of an immobilized foe before landing a crushing strike.

When you expend a martial exploit when attacking a target that cannot move or with a speed of 0 with a two-handed melee weapon or a versatile one wielded in two hands, you gain an additional +2 bonus per die used as a bonus to your weapon damage roll.

entries.name: Mountain's Grasp
entries: Your blows land with such force that your enemy is left off balance, unable to escape your brutal assault.

When you expend a martial exploit when attacking with a two-handed melee weapon or a versatile one wielded in two hands, after rolling the dice you can select at least two of them and disregard their results. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Sweeping Bludgeon
entries: As you ready to strike your enemy, you sweep your weapon around you in a great arc that builds momentum and forces your enemies to dive to the ground to avoid a crushing blow.

When you expend a martial exploit when attacking with a two-handed melee weapon or a versatile one wielded in two hands, after rolling the dice you can select one or more of them and disregard their result. For each die selected, pick a creature within reach of your attack. Each chosen creature must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Way of the Blade
entries: Starting at 7th level, you blend your martial talent with the softer skills needed to navigate the world. If you are holding a weapon when you make a Strength (Athletics), Dexterity (Acrobatics), or Charisma (Intimidation) check, you gain a bonus to the roll equal to half your proficiency bonus. You use your weapon to assist in your check, such as pole vaulting with a staff, using your sword to aid your balance, or menacing an enemy with your bloodied flail.

entries.name: Superior Fighting Style
entries: Starting at 10th level, your mastery of your fighting style deepens. You can choose a second option from the Fighting Style feature you gain at 2nd level, or you can choose an improved version of a fighting style you already know as detailed below.

entries.name: Superior Archery
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Superior Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. You also gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

entries.name: Superior Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +4 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Superior Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1, 2, or 3 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is 1, 2, or 3. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Superior Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll and make an opportunity attack against the attacker. You must be wielding a shield.

entries.name: Superior Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack. You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.
